intro: Pentacalia ptariana, commonly known as the silverleaf pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the Asteraceae family. Pentacalia ptariana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
